intro.intro_1: Mom died last month. Or maybe it was the month before.
intro.intro_2: I decided to sell the old family house, a little dwelling in the suburbs.
intro.intro_3: I haven't been there in years.

level1.ball_right: Mom scold me every afternoon for playing around her flower pots.
level1.ball_callback_right: Darn! The ball is punctured. That cartridge put me in the mood for some kicking.
level1.cartridge_left: Amazing games about ninjas who play soccer to save the world. You can borrow it if you like.
level1.cartridge_right: Super Ninja Soccer Star Warrior 3 for NES! I loved this game!
level1.door_left: I'm not done playing outside. If I get inside now, mom will insist I make my homework!
level1.pot_left: Mom loves this stupid plant. She says it can grow up to be huge. I doubt it.
level1.pot_right: Stupid plant, it would be moderately inconvenient to get through it! I should've destroyed it when I had the chance.
level1.memory_trigger: This place hasn't changed at all. I feel... like a child.

level2.cookies_left: Best to put this away. I don't wanna get grounded for life!
level2.couch_left: we have this couch in case a guest wants to watch us have dinner.
level2.couch_right: Dad insisted on buying this third couch. It was preposterous.
level2.couchs_left: Since I moved the TV to my room, these couchs are hardly used. Mom and Dad aren't the "sit and chit chat over a cup of coffee" type.
level2.couchs_right: Every stain in these couchs tells a story. A sticky and smelly tale, in most cases.
level2.cupboard_left: Our family's cupboard. Dad's hidden whisky bottle seems to be working after hours lately.
level2.cupboard_right: Can't remember why we ended up putting these old phone records up here.
level2.cupboard_full_left: Now the cupboard is full of crumbs. Mom said I clean up the table, didn't mention anything about getting dirty other stuff.
level2.cupboard_open_right: The rat sure looks comfortable in the cupboard. At least SOMEONE managed to live peacefully in this house.
level2.door_left: Don't be a bummer. It's too early to go to bed.
level2.door_right: The door is jammed. I think there was some kind of trick to open it...
level2.joystick_right: My old joystick! It has my bite marks on it. Damned "Nintendo hard".
level2.note_right: It's an old note: "Left you some afternoon snacks. Don't forget to clean up the table after eating!" Mom
level2.phone_left: Mom said I should only call in an emergency.
level2.phone_right: I can't understand how there is people that still use one of these cursed machines.
level2.phone_ring_left: MOM: Stop playing games! Go to your room and do your homework. Your dad jammed the door out of rage. Remember holding X, Y and B while opening.
level2.phone_ring_right: So... holding X, Y and B while opening. Mom sure called from work to tell me the weirdest stuff.
level2.phonebook_right: Mom's phonebook. She wrote her work's number in a corner of the cover.
level2.picture_left: Dad, Mom and me portrayed in probably the last time we were all in the same room over the last two years
level2.picture_right: I remember the day we took that picture. We needed to finish the cammera roll.
level2.rat_right: There's something under this rat, but she's ravenous! I won't risk touching her.

level3.car1_left: This is my favorite toy car!
level3.car2_left: This is my least favorite toy car.
level3.car2_right: I don't know why, but I've always resented this race car.
level3.chest_left: I always put away my toys and games. Why do they say I misbehave?
level3.drawer_left: My best marbles, my walkie-talkie, my Pok√©mon stickers. All safe and sound in my nightstand.
level3.drawer_right: I used to put all my most beloved stuff here. They are all in perfect shape to this day!
level3.library_left: Mom and Dad won't come home 'til midnight. I'm in no rush to do my homework.
level3.library_right: "Alice in Blunderland", "The Racist Duckling", "Choose Your Own Advertisement"... These were some reall crappy kid books.
level3.tv_left: Oh, it's almost time for Dragon Ball Z! But better don't get distracted...
